q: state pupils Mrs Roberts finds herself agreeing with Education Secretary Michael Gove 's new method for measuring school performance. She believes league tables have encouraged schools to discourage pupils from taking "harder" GCSEs. League tables have offered a perverse incentive to schools- schools have been tempted to provide courses that will confer league table success on the school, says Mrs Roberts. Carolyn Roberts says the new measure will force schools to offer rigorous subjects Mrs Roberts says some pupils who join her comprehensive school in the sixth form "already have doors closed to them
